cv

General Information

Full Name Charles Le Losq
Date of Birth 14th December 1986
Languages French, English

Education

  • 2012
    Ph.D.
    Institut de physique du globe de Paris, France
    • Role of alkali elements and water on the properties and structure of aluminosilicate melts and glasses.
  • 2009
    Master
    Institut de physique du globe de Paris, France
    • Geology and Natural Hazards.
  • 2007
    Licence
    University of Poitiers, France
    • Geosciences.

Experience

  • 2019 - present
    Maître de Conférences (Assist. Prof.)
    Institut de physique du globe de Paris, France
  • 2015-2019
    Research Fellow
    Research School of Earth Sciences, Australian National University, Australia
  • 2013-2015
    Postdoctoral Fellow
    Geophysical Laboratory, Carnegie Institution for Sciences, U.S.A.

Open Source Projects

  • 2021-now
    i-Melt
    • A machine learning model of the properties of aluminosilicate melts and glasses.
  • 2016-now
    Spectra
    • A Julia library for spectral data processing (IR, Raman, XAS...).
  • 2016-now
    rampy
    • Python library for spectral data processing (IR, Raman, XAS...).
  • 2016-now
    gcvspline
    • A Python interface to the GCVspline fortran library.
  • 2020-now
    gcvspl
    • Julia wrapper of the GCV spline FORTRAN program.

Academic Interests

  • Earth sciences
    • Atomic structure and physical properties of magmas
    • Volatiles in terrestrial planets
    • Magma oceans
    • Volcanic eruptions
    • super-Earths
  • Material Science
    • Glass structure & properties
    • Silicate melts
    • Volatiles in minerals and glasses
    • Redox conditions
  • Machine learning and optimization
    • ML methods applied to spectral processing (Raman, XANES, NMR...)
    • Bayesian modeling
    • Neural networks (FF, Bayesian, VAE, GAN...)

Other Interests

  • Hobbies: Rock climbing, motorcycling, downhill skateboarding, guitar, videogames, hicking, mountains, nature
